content:
Both currently work with the FHIR Validator https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Using+the+FHIR+Validator

For UK Core use the following parameters:

-version 4.0.1

-ig https://packages.simplifier.net/uk.core.r4/-/uk.core.r4-1.1.0.tgz

For CareConnect (note this uses INTEROPens version of the resources)

-version 3.0
-ig https://interopen.github.io/careconnect-base-stu3/
@Kevin Mayfield you will get mixed results as many of the SNOMED valuesets still have errors in their ECL syntax.
Note, Ontoserver can be used to validate the ECL syntax :-)
and should be used to validate syntax. It should then be used with validation tools to test conformance resources?

The errors in ECL don't require tools to fix them, the syntactic issues are clear. Sites such as https://www.ihtsdo.org/SCT-ecl-brief.html have been around for some time. Worse still the issues reported in CareConnect (STU3) have been replicated into the UK Core (R4). Tools aside, there needs to be a desire to do the right thing....
I think we may need to automatically test conformance resources.
